item.title: Gait is in a huge pothole, 21st January
item.description:
Gait is in a huge pothole and as usual I avoided it quite often, but for some reason I wasn’t thinking, and I drove over it. But it was a terrible thing. I’ve had a stroke and I have Aphasia - I wrote to you around 6 months ago and told you that I had had my suspension replaced. I didn’t receive a reply. I want to discuss this with you and I hope I haven’t got an another suspension issue. Thank you Chris greenhough
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Contractors (Ringway) left this fencing here over 12 months ago. Despite raising it here, the fencing remains. Please get contractors to remove and tidy area.

item.title: Heavy littering- need rubbish bin, 21st January
item.description:
Every week significant amounts of litter are deposited in this area, much is pushed into bushes, some just dropped on grass verge. I believe it is due to the location relative to the Tesco shop as much of the rubbish is ‘on the go’ stuff. A rubbish bin here would encourage people to dispose of litter responsibly and reduce street cleaning costs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hewlett Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane full of debris, 21st January
item.description:
The entire length of the new, segregated cycle lane up the hill on the Cirencester Road is full of debris. This has been dirty since the start of winter but the accumulation of debris has become deep enough to make it difficult to maintain a predictable path on a bicycle. I would be grateful if this lane can be swept as the new surface and updated infrastructure is fantastic!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping., 21st January
item.description:
Hi there. The triangle at the end of Laxton Walk is building up a nice collection of fly tipping. Was a sofa that's been there for several weeks and has now been joined by a turtle sandpit...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Laxton Walk, St Mark's, Cheltenham

item.title: Very overgrown trees encroaching on both the highway & housing, 21st January
item.description:
The wooded area at the end of Appleton Way and adjoining the residential property at 44 Appleton Way. The trees in this area appear to have been unmaintained for many years, their height and overhang is now causing safety issues and concerns for both road users and property. One tree has already blown over in the centre of this area. I have had damage to both my vehicles and property as a result of debris (branches) falling. On the road the street lamp has been entirely consumed by the overgrowth. These trees need cutting back (from overhanging the road and the above mentioned property) and the height reducing as a matter of urgency. This area appears to be entirely unmaintained.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poorly completed driveway work across foot way., 21st January
item.description:
The drive way for 88(?) landsdown road has been relaid and has essentially been lain on top of the footpath and cycle path essentially creating a pronounced bump of approx 35mm up and down creating a trip hazard for pedestrians and risks wheel damage to cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88b, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
